padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2247912" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Vorpal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821877"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1821877.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Vorpal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Percival-51037.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51037.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Percival"title="Percival"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2247912ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2247912" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1821877">Vorpal</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-13">08/13/24 10:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Approaching Silver Mountain Water with a fresh perspective, I found it to be an "alright" scent, rather than a standout experience. Initially, it delivers a clean, crisp experience, but soon transforms into a musky skin scent that, while pleasant, feels somewhat basic.<br />
<br />
This fragrance did spark my interest enough in exploring alternatives and inspirations, such as Armafs Sillage and Xerjoffs Mefisto, which may offer more distinctive variations and added character.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2247912"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2247912#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2246970" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2246970" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="rafatmyo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260064"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1260064.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="rafatmyo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Thomas-Kosmala/No4-Neon-89047.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.89047.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="N4 Neon"title="N4 Neon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2246970ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2246970" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1260064">rafatmyo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-12">08/12/24 12:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This perfume has a delicious and addictive fragrance. Its initial notes are fresh, but the real magic happens during the dry-down. Even after several days, you can still catch a whiff of it on your clothes. The only downside might be that its sillage doesnt last very long, but thats understandable for a fresh perfume.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2246970"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2246970#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2245878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2245878" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Oleyc"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040918"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2040918.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Oleyc" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Roja-Dove/Oceania-57385.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.57385.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oceania"title="Oceania"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2245878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2245878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.84); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040918">Oleyc</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-11">08/11/24 10:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance smells like a cool breeze. Good for the beach and summer. But nothing fancy. Even for a daily wear its not very good. Not a compliment getter by any means. I believe its because it smells like a barber shop. I like it but I wouldn't rebuy this even on a heavy discount</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2245878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2245878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2243058" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2243058" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="doc_strangelife"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1954059"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1954059.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="doc_strangelife" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2243058ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2243058" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1954059">doc_strangelife</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-08">08/08/24 14:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Heard praise for the performance of new F batches (F001598.) After years of negativity towards Creed's performance, a consensus which seemed to be positive made me curious enough to buy at retail.<br />
<br />
SCENT: Unisex, perfect for men and women. Though skeptical at first, this is currently my favorite fragrance. Suits any occasion, season, and time of day. That being said, it is best in warmer weather and during the day. Extraordinarily smooth and luxurious. Refreshingly clean and put together while charmingly sweet and inviting. The green tea is the most prominent note to my nose. <br />
<br />
LONGEVITY: I had heard that longevity and performance was very poor, but from what I have read and have experienced, I can say that F batches perform very well as far as I can tell despite anosmia, which occurs with most Creeds. At least three hours on and my fraghead coworker remarked that it smells as though it had just been applied. I couldn't smell it at all though. <br />
<br />
PERFORMANCE: Don't expect a monster. It projects moderately and that's generally how I prefer it. I don't want people all the way in Buenos Aires to smell me. I prefer to think of Creeds as discoverable rather than the first thing you notice.<br />
<br />
PRICE: $500 at retail is nutzo, get it for ~$250 from discounters, if the F batch conjecture is true, you might pay a lil premium for a newer bottle. It's still expensive, but I would 100% buy it again. <br />
<br />
SIDE NOTES: The metal cap clinking against the bottle is very pleasing to the ear. <br />
<br />
Might possibly be a 10/10 masterpiece for me at least. Incredible stuff.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2243058"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2243058#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2242106" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2242106" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="_fernmoss"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160310"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="_fernmoss" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2242106ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2242106" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2160310">_fernmoss</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-07">08/07/24 16:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Not always wanting to wear this, but when I do its on the hottest days. The floral and tea notes combined with ambergris shines in 90+ degree weather. Very versatile, unisex/slight masculine tilt. <br />
<br />
9/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2242106"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2242106#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238466" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2238466" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="LostSock"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1500461"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1500461.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="LostSock" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gucci/Gucci-pour-Homme-2003-691.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.691.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gucci pour Homme (2003)"title="Gucci pour Homme (2003)"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2238466ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2238466" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1500461">LostSock</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-08-04">08/04/24 06:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Sir Reeksalot. The plant/shrub isn't allowed in America, the oil isn't banned nor its aromachemical equivalent. I think it's banned due to how rampantly it grows and takes over everything around it. <br />
<br />
Americans would be most unamused if it were banned in perfumery, blackcurrant is a note in one of the most popular scents on the planet including America, that being Aventus. <br />
<br />
As a Brit I adore blackcurrant, almost every dark purple sweet or drink you'll come across in the UK is blackcurrant (not grape like in the USA) but I'll be honest and say I've never detected it in SMW, and I can't detect it in Aventus either. I can in Moschino's Cheap &amp; Chic though.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2238466"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2238466#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2238436" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1705658">WPMO</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-30">07/30/24 18:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have a sample of this and I've worn it a couple times, as well as just spraying on myself to smell. Unfortunately it is a very weak scent. I think the small itself is alright - definitely complex, but I don't love it. It's an interesting scent, which is not anywhere near enough to justify the price. For $100 a bottle this would be an interesting addition to the collection that I might wear from time to time just to be different. At current prices? No way.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2234191"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2234191#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2232913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:4,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2232913" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gt63"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2190693"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2190693.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gt63" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2232913ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2232913" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2190693">Gt63</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-29">07/29/24 13:06</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>(Strong Green Ozonic) Green Irish Tweed. James Bond <br />
(Medium ozonic/aquatic) Silver Mountain Water. Bruce Wayne <br />
(Light aquatic) Millsime Imprial. Christian Grey<br />
<br />
Pierre Bourdon Created Green Irish Tweed in 1985. He created SMW and Milly off of GIT. Hence why if you like one of them you will like all 3. Also Cool Water is created off GIT as well. He made a daily off the father GIT.<br />
<br />
Girls love SMW very simple.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2232913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2232913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2227754" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2227754" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="vaan1236"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/977006"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.977006.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="vaan1236" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2227754ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2227754" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/977006">vaan1236</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-24">07/24/24 02:43</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>For some reason, women go crazy whenever I wear SMW. <br />
<br />
I was at the supermarket and was being followed by two girls. When I sat down at the table to eat, they were sitting right behind me where I usually apply my fragrances at the back of my neck. There was this other time where I stopped by McDonald's to eat before I went to work. As I was standing in line to wait for my order, one of the female employees was standing abnormally close behind me where I applied SMW at the back of my neck. When I went to work and was walking down the hallway, one of my female coworkers was walking close behind me to get a whiff of the scent and my other female coworker was asking customers and employees if they were wearing a fragrance. When she came up to me she was like, "It is you! Omg you smell amazing! What is that?" <br />
<br />
I only bought this fragrance because it smelled clean while being classy at the same time without being boring and strong. I never knew how popular it be among the ladies.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2227754"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2227754#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2224371" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2224371" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Pick"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040463"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Pick" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2224371ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2224371" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2040463">Pick</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-20">07/20/24 10:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Right off the top you can smell that calming tea note together with a kind of watery essence that feels soft and incredibly light and it is in my opinion the star of the show in this cologne.<br />
You'll be able to smell the citrus, the blackcurrant, the woods but that musky watery note truly gives character to this cologne. It creates a cleanliness unlike anything I've ever smelled before, it's the scent of an incredibly clean fabric mixed with a watery green smell, as if your standing in the middle of the forst sipping water as you get the smell of the trees surrounding you.<br />
But this is not aquatic, it's watery, it does not have a fruity aquatic scent like Aqua Di Gio, nor a salty marine accord like light blue eau intense, instead it creates this light clean watery feel that's unique to this cologne and this cologne only <br />
<br />
If you want to smell incredibly clean, almost to a point where it doesn't really feel like your wearing a cologne, this is for you. <br />
I absolutely love this scent</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2224371"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2224371#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2224122" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2224122" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FragranceKing31"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2101468"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2101468.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FragranceKing31" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2224122ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2224122" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2101468">FragranceKing31</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-20">07/20/24 04:37</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells like Jaguar classic black but less harsh and more sweat</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2224122"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2224122#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2222952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2222952" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tylerg822"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1915564"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1915564.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tylerg822" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2222952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2222952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1915564">tylerg822</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-18">07/18/24 21:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Ah yes creed, the fragrance house that manages to sell a fragrance for $200+ that smells like green apple hand soap from the dollar store. is it pleasing, yes, is it good? one can beg to differ. But is it worth the price, absolutely not. It is beyond mediocre and nothing special, best creed ive smelled is virgin island waters. Even then, the price tag is still the biggest problem with creed. Boring scents that smell quite cheap honestly, and theyre being pumped out for $200+. what a robbery.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2222952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2222952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2222536" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2206625" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="player1363"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480218"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1480218.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="player1363" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2206625ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2206625" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1480218">player1363</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-07-03">07/03/24 01:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mainly a green tea fragrance, fresh and refreshing. But the longevity is not satisfying for the price tag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2206625"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2206625#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2205577" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2198687" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Green_Goddess_707"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2174439"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2174439.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Green_Goddess_707" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Etat-Libre-d-Orange/Archives-69-11411.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.11411.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Archives 69"title="Archives 69"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2198687ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2198687" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2174439">Green_Goddess_707</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-24">06/24/24 22:17</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love the scent. Hate the price. Ive tried clones, they never get the same effect, always too synthetic. This is also a scent that I can call upon from memory and I frequently smell it when I havent used it in months, just randomly throughout the house or car. It will work its way into your life but not in a totally horrible way, just in a really expensive but what is that delicious smell kind of way. I actually prefer it in the winter. Something about the cold and the way this resonates with icy, coolness makes it a match in my book. But gosh, did I mention its expensive?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2198687"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2198687#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2196016" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2196016" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Om3r_perfumes"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140989"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2140989.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Om3r_perfumes" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Oajan-21548.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.21548.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oajan"title="Oajan"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2196016ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2196016" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2140989">Om3r_perfumes</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-22">06/22/24 07:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Creeds Silver Mountain Water opens up amazingly! The bergamont , orange and tea note gives it a perfect summer opening. The tea note in this is soo likable and keeps this scent unique. However you can only enjoy this momment for maximum the first hour. After that you get a more woody and musky feel. <br />
<br />
I do love the scent but its longevity is hurendous. It lasts about 3-4 hours and has 0 projection. Although the scent is great it doesnt project even with over spraying. And this scent is just extremely over priced, youre paying 400USD for something with 0 performance. That is why I do not recommend to get this scent, I own the clone from club de Nuit which is identical in smell with superior performance. <br />
<br />
Scent: 8<br />
Projection: 1<br />
Longevity: 4<br />
Value: 1<br />
Overall: 4</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2196016"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2196016#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2193234" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2193234" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="NauticaVoyageFan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2114601"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2114601.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="NauticaVoyageFan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/By-Kilian/Black-Phantom-43632.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.43632.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Phantom"title="Black Phantom"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2193234ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2193234" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2114601">NauticaVoyageFan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-19">06/19/24 12:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Silver Mountain Water by Creed is an amazing summer and spring fragrance to smells very unique and like an intellectual with a really good and powerful tea note which you don't get often from many fragrances now but Creed where able to do this perfectly and with its really nice opening of bergamot and orange I would absolutely recommend this fragrance to anyone just from the way it smells alone. I find this to be a masterpiece in my opinion in terms of the way it smells and a fragrance like this is hard to find. The $470 price for this is slightly overpriced in my opinion but I wouldn't find this to be much of a drawback as it smells amazing.<br />
<br />
However, the issue with this fragrance is its longevity just like any summer fragrance this lasts around 5-6 hours on my skin so nothing is out of the ordinary, and its projection is pretty weak so doesn't leave much of a trail but I will admit this smells amazing up close.<br />
<br />
Scent: 10/10<br />
Performance: 7/10<br />
Longevity: 6/10<br />
Sillage: 6/10<br />
Price: 5/10<br />
Blind Buy Safe: 7/10<br />
Overall: 8/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2193234"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2193234#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2188822" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2188822" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fred Hillman"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2149975"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fred Hillman" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2188822ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2188822" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2149975">Fred Hillman</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-15">06/15/24 01:01</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>According to Gabe Oppenheim, what we know as Silver Mountain Water was initially rejected for the submission of L'Eau D'Issey Pour Homme. In typical Creed style, quadruple the price and market it as some kind of luxury fragrance and the masses will bow.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2188822"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2188822#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2186902" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2186902" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tanyako"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2157267"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2157267.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tanyako" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2186902ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2186902" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2157267">tanyako</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-13">06/13/24 07:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>First impression - masculine deodorant opening. Bergamot. Im hearing quiet Mandarine in the distance very far away. <br />
Very smooth, I imagine a blonde man with sleek hair. Good for being outdoors, blends well with nature notes. Not sweet at all. Green tea notes. Very sterile smell. Someone called it asexual. Does not make me want to smell myself. Not delicious. Strict, reserved. Also headache inducing a little bit. But Im a girl so my perception might be skewed. I was looking for a fresh mountain air scent and this is not it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2186902"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2186902#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2184474" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2184474" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="docelder"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924816"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="docelder" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2184474ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2184474" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1924816">docelder</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-10">06/10/24 21:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So far, nobody has duplicated this scent. That I have found anyway. Despite the note profile that doesn't appear at least on the surface to be that difficult to do. I had a full bottle and gifted it to one of my sons. Then, I kind of missed having it, even though I didn't wear it that much. I have a lot of lighter fresh scents and I prefer those kind of scents over the heavier sweeter ones, being in South Florida. So, I tried some of the clones, thinking I just wanted to have it to wear sometimes anyway. Sun Java, Silver Shade, and Dossier are similar to one another with an inky note and it overpowers the tea note. That ink note is either overdone, or missing altogether. Some use a violet leaf for some reason. IE Supremacy in Heaven and Sillage. They just can't get it. Oddly enough the Bvlgari Rain Essence is the only scent that reminds me of the subtle brilliance of the SMW scent itself, without going overboard on the inky note. It even has a slight inky undertone, less than in SMW, but nailing the implementation, without overdoing it. I understand why, as Bvlgari doesn't want bottles coming back to retailers from us unwashed masses that want something different, yet non challenging overall. Of course, it's not listed above in the reminds me of section. But it's close enough for me, though I don't think rote duplication was a goal, but the vibe certainly had to be intentional. Alberto nailed the subtlety of it. I think maybe it's the signature creed base that is missing in clones that makes it so hard to re-create. In lighter fragrances, the base becomes more prominent. Not sure. This is light and long lasting for a lighter fragrance. Of course, mine was from 2010 and that might be impossible to find even if someone got an original bottle from the newer batches. If you really like this one, at least for now, there's the original and nothing else really.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2184474"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2184474#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2183561" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2183561" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bnknowsfrag"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2132381"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2132381.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bnknowsfrag" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2183561ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2183561" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2132381">Bnknowsfrag</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-10">06/10/24 02:02</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>So I got this fragrance in a creed discovery set and this was soo good, creed is one of the most underrated houses oat in my opinion and has some of the best freshies on the market, e.g. silver mountain water, himalaya and virgin island water. Personally this is my 2nd favourite creed behind green Irish tweed. I love the realistic citrus notes in this fragrance mixed with the soft spices, as the name suggests this smells exactly like a walk through the cold mountainous forests. The performance is ok but could bring people away from buying this scent. Overall I think I might have to get this and is a banger.<br />
<br />
Smell 9.4/10<br />
Sillage 6.8/10<br />
Longevity 7/10<br />
Bottle 8.4/10<br />
How much would I pay for it. 50ml: 150</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2183561"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2183561#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2183489" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2183489" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FreshLiving"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1043744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FreshLiving" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2183489ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2183489" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744">FreshLiving</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-09">06/09/24 22:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Finally had my F Batch bottle arrive. Theres not much else to say what hasnt already been said below.<br />
<br />
Its magical, very alluring, very cooling and refreshing. I can see this working best in both summer and winter as different aspects will present themselves. So when I do wear this in summer Ill keep it for the evening and night. Compliment getter for sure.<br />
<br />
Performance on this isnt my best Creed, but its not gone in an hour. I get about 3-4 hours of good projection and then for the next 4 hours it settles in to a skin scent. And yes, I wish it was a beast (not sure why creed decided to suffer itself in the performance department as if they had better performance I could guarantee they would own the whole fragrance market; but people simply cant justify the cost)<br />
With that being said, I can understand why people opt for the clone, for the price to performance with sillage. <br />
But to me, Id rather smell amazing for a little than terribly synthetic for 1 hour and morph in to something good for longer.  To me its always about quality time than quantity of it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2183489"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2183489#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182206" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182206" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SmellSharpe"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447620"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1447620.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="SmellSharpe" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Virgin-Island-Water-899.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.899.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Virgin Island Water"title="Virgin Island Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182206ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182206" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1447620">SmellSharpe</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 13:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Rating based on a recently received new 100ml F-batch bottle.<br />
<br />
No idea how this could be a skin scent in an hour on anyone, but it is far from beastly. It projects very well initially and fades fairly quickly. It does last a good 4-5 hours on me and I get whiffs of it all day. It has average staying power for a niche or high end designer spring/summer fragrance, but not bad by any stretch.<br />
<br />
The initial blast of bergamot and a touch of tea is amazing. Anyone familiar with this fragrance would know it anywhere. It dries down to a nice blend of tea and musky woods with a touch of black currant.<br />
<br />
It is an excellent fragrance and the new batches seem to last longer than what was released a few years ago but it is very expensive for what you get. $250-ish/100ml from discounters isnt a bad price, but $450 at retail? Thats nutty.<br />
<br />
Armaf Sillage is pretty damned good/close for a 10th of the price and Xerjoff Mefisto is a bit different in profile but lasts longer than SMW for around 1/2-1/3 the price. I am happy to own and frequently wear all 3.<br />
<br />
TLDR The new F batches of SMW last very well but this is pricy stuff with some very good similar fragrances available for less $$$.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2182206"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2182206#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2182073" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2182073" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Literally 1984"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158041"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2158041.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Literally 1984" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2182073ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2182073" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2158041">Literally 1984</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-08">06/08/24 10:33</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I have no idea what the person below me is talking about, the performance on this is absolutely pathetic. My biggest gripe with creed (of whom I own many fragrances from) is their performance, ESPECIALLY when you take into account their cost. Does it smell good? Yes. But it feels like this is at a 5% concentration, because it's a skin scent within an hour, at most. If you are going to get this, I hope you have the money to buy multiple 100 ml bottles because I had to spray 10+ times just to get some decent performance out of it, whereas I usually am fine with just 3-4, max 5. 7/10.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2182073"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2182073#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2180085" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2180085" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="AtlanteanTrident"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2142185"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="AtlanteanTrident" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2180085ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2180085" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2142185">AtlanteanTrident</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-06-06">06/06/24 10:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This fragrance is maybe the most unique offering from Creed and is most definitely one of the absolute best fragrances ever made. <br />
<br />
The name Silver Mountain Water brings to mind images of glaciers and snow-capped peaks in the highest, most rugged landscapes on earth as well as the many freshwater springs that originate there and the juice in this bottle captures that feeling perfectly. While you'd assume this means this is a winter fragrance, I feel Creed wanted the wearer to feel that cold mountain air and spring water of that landscape. It is for this reason most people consider it a spring and summer fragrance. It has a very cooling feel to it. <br />
<br />
The scent opens up with a citrusy blast which is more bergamot than it is mandarin. There is a slight sweet citrus accord which I'd say is perhaps the mandarin but to me it smells more like a sweet lemon and a very realistic one at that. Does not smell like bathroom cleaner or an Air Wick/Glade air freshener. The fragrance then immediately begins to project this very unique note that a lot of people either love or hate and that smell is kind of what defines Silver Mountain Water. The smell of tea alongside the blackcurrant produces an almost 'ink' like smell. Imagine the smell of ink being laid on fresh parchment paper or smelling the ink inside of a glass jar. It smells inky because that is kind of the impression both smells together give off but when you put your skin up to your nose, you can very clearly make out both the tea and the blackcurrant notes separately. It is because of these two notes, I'd say the fragrance leans more masculine than being unisex and is something that I can't get enough of once I've smelt it. <br />
<br />
It also projects really well and has tremendous sillage. Performance is very good for the first 4 hours at least, after which it tends to become a skin scent although you continue to catch wafts of the fragrance a good 8-10 hours after application. If you spray on clothes, you'll be smelling it a good day/two days after. <br />
<br />
The dry down on the fragrance comes in at the 5 hour mark (around the same time the scent becomes more of a skin scent) and the musk, sandalwood, petitgrain base is so sophisticated and well done. This fragrance is excellent both in the day time and at night and is perfect for the office as well as for a nice dinner. The smell is a little bit on the mature side so I would say this is probably best suited to a man 25 years old and above. <br />
<br />
One of the best offerings from Creed and probably the most unique fresh fragrance you'll smell. Could not recommend it more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2180085"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2180085#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2171376" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2171376" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GIT"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388371"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388371.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GIT" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2171376ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2171376" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388371">GIT</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-29">05/29/24 09:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@FreshLiving<br />
<br />
Even light and heat can induce chemical reactions on substances, just leave your bottle on the sun for a week and see what happens with what is inside of it. Light excites the electrons on the aldehyde compounds and on the presence of oxygen even little exothermic reactions can occur.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2171376"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2171376#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2171058" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2171058" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="timmybils"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1773009"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1773009.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="timmybils" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/SpongeBob-Squarepants/Squidward-28290.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.28290.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Squidward"title="Squidward"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2171058ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2171058" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.9);
