Just curious</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2171058"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2171058#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2170786" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2170786" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FreshLiving"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1043744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FreshLiving" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2170786ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2170786" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744">FreshLiving</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-28">05/28/24 18:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>@GIT<br />
<br />
Even the chemist below me stated that maceration doesnt happen in the bottle. <br />
<br />
Ive had Aventus since 2016, and it performs like it did back then. I think the idea of bottle maceration is a bit of wishful thinking. <br />
Sadly Creeds, as amazing as they are, just dont perform like beasts. Its sad. Ill still buy and wear them, as I believe they are the best scents on the market but Ive come to accept this fact that maceration is in a way some version of buyers remorse and failing to accept the fact that Creeds are spotty performers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2170786"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2170786#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2166639" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2166639" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="GIT"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388371"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1388371.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="GIT" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2166639ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2166639" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1388371">GIT</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-24">05/24/24 11:12</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The comment below posting a reply from Creed's customer service stating maceration and air exposure is a myth is total nonsense to me, as i have been using Creed's fragrances for years and it always turns out to be true, after a few months the fragrance does get better. Trust me, after years using the same fragrance over and over and testing different batches and formulations, i know the difference. The question is that this only works with fragrances made from natural ingredients where oxidation could occur inside the bottle, but that is not the truth anymore nowadays with Creed. Since Blackrock bought the company, they are all synthetic and an emulation of the original formulas. No wonder why the prices of vintage batches only go up on secondary markets. I must admit that my beloved Green Irish Tweed is still good, but the newer versions of Silver Mountain Water are just a joke, nothing close to the older ones.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2166639"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2166639#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2165828" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2165828" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ChuckMijo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1490216"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="ChuckMijo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2165828ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2165828" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1490216">ChuckMijo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-23">05/23/24 17:26</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Well what can I say about this that hasnt already been said. I have worn this for a long time. Not sure when exactly, somewhere in late 90s. I typically go through a bottle every 2 years or so. I have bought many bottles. Its absolutely my favorite fragrance . SMW on me opens up with a strong bergamot and citrus opening. That on me lasts about 15 minutes or so. Then I get this, crinkle up a ball of aluminum foil and smell it. That sounds weird, but its what I get. That cold metal fragrance with citrus. Then 20 minutes later on me I get that same metal smell along with floral notes, not necessarily feminine but beautiful  and unisex. Then this ink like smell gets mixed in . Take a pen and smell the ink . There you have it. Mix metal, ink ,florals and you have it. Its not going to be for everyone, and thats the way it should be. Get a sample and live with it for yourself. There isnt anything that smells quite like it. My wife and daughters love it on me. I would say its unique, unisex but leans masculine. I want to add this , this probably will not appeal to those younger folks. I get it. Im 50 . My youngest son is in his 20s thinks its smell like Grandma Purfume. Edit.. I have received a lot of messages asking if this is still worth buying, or is it reformulated. All I can say is there is only 2 perfumes I have worn since they were released, SMW and Prada Amber Pour Homme. SMW smells the exactly the same to me as the very first bottle I bought. I honestly cant tell any difference from bottle  to bottle. This is one I truly know. Maybe their is a difference or it has been reformulated, I cant tell  or noticed anything different. If you spray this on your shirt you will absolutely smell it the next day. Hope that answers your questions.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2165828"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2165828#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2165369" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2165369" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="FreshLiving"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1043744.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="FreshLiving" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2165369ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2165369" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1043744">FreshLiving</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-23">05/23/24 09:24</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is from creed customer service:<br />
<br />
Great question about maceration! The idea of air exposure strengthening Creed fragrances is a web myth.<br />
<br />
True maceration happens during a controlled aging process, not after bottling. Air exposure can actually weaken the fragrance and alter its scent composition. Trust freshness! Store Creed fragrances in a cool, dark place and it is advised to buy from authorized retailers.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2165369"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2165369#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2164808" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2164808" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ScentedJuan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081042"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2081042.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ScentedJuan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Percival-51037.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.51037.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Percival"title="Percival"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2164808ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2164808" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2081042">ScentedJuan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-22">05/22/24 20:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This one was a total blind buy. It was the green tea note that intrigued me. Ya' blind bought a fragrance for one note!? Yes, I did. From what I was hearing and what I had experienced of Creed to that point. I expected Silver Mountain Water to be good. But not as good as I find it to be. <br />
<br />
Like all the Creed's I tried before this one, it silently screams of quality. The opening is fresh, clean and crisp air. The note list here says floral in general but in the crisp air of Silver Mountain Water I smell a distinct rose. I was suprised as I hadn't heard anyone mention it. I love it! The smell imaged in my mind a dried rose. Dull and darkened in color (probably purple ish) but very fragrant, and beautiful under a bright blue sky. A faint indirect sweetness is also sensed. In this scene appears, refreshing energetic tea in a metal cup or rather a chic metal flask. And perhaps a pen is on site also to log the expedition. The enduring woody musk capturing the nature of it all. <br />
<br />
I don't know if it's due to a good batch or my skin. Either way I get good longevity out this. Average 8 to 9hrs. My longest was 11hrs. Typically I apply to 2 sprays on the back of the neck just below each ears. And 1 sprays to the chest and shirt if I'm feeling good. It last days on clothes. I still smelled it on the collar of my windbreaker a week after applying. For this reason and stains is why I'm careful with what fragrances I spray on clothes.<br />
<br />
I'm not one to fish for complements with my fragrances as I wear them for myself. But this one really draws them in consistently. One of the most memorable was when I walked past two ladies and one of them yelled from behind me "GOD! you smell good!". I got SMW for the green tea but it was the overlooked, mysterious, muted rose that took me. This is among my the top 5 favorite Creed fragrances.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2164808"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2164808#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2163805" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2163805" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="chansey"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1694210"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1694210.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="chansey" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Xerjoff/Erba-Pura-55157.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55157.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Erba Pura"title="Erba Pura"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2163805ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2163805" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.87); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1694210">chansey</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-21">05/21/24 23:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>smells like a salty wet vipe nothing special also performance just doesn t exist</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2163805"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2163805#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2162143" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2162143" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Scents &amp; blooms"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1485244"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Scents &amp; blooms" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Frederic-M/Le-Soleil-Brille-23748.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.23748.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Soleil Brille"title="Le Soleil Brille"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2162143ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2162143" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1485244">Scents &amp; blooms</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-20">05/20/24 11:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I am a chemist &amp; perfumer and just wanted to share my clarification on some comments here about the requirement of a perfume macerating in a bottle after purchase. I dont mean to offend anyone,just thought it needed clarification. Shop bought Perfume in a bottle simply cant be macerated( will explain in detail below). This is misguided information currently circulating online. <br />
<br />
When perfume bottles hit the shop floor, ready for purchase, they are completely ready to be used from day 1 &amp; is exactly how the manufacturer intended it to be.<br />
<br />
Some customers find when an opened bottle of perfume has been stowed away for 6 months or so &amp; when they try it again,the scent may appear stronger, one reason for this may be because some of the alcohol in an opened bottle of perfume may have evaporated since denatured alcohol evaporates very easily &amp; hence the scent may appear stronger or sometimes it may just be changes to your body temperature from when you applied last time etc but it has nothing to do with macerating! <br />
<br />
Macerating something would require there are some solid particles in a solution. For example if you add chamomile flowers to a jar with some sunflower oil &amp; leave it in a closed bottle for weeks or months,that would be called macerating! Since perfume in your bottle has no solid particles,there is no such thing as macerating perfume in a bottle.<br />
<br />
The fragrance part of a Perfume is pre-blended and approved long before any bottle of perfume is made! It is already well blended and ready which is then mixed with alcohol, water etc to make the bottle of perfume you buy in a store!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2162143"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2162143#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2155064" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2155064" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karlovonamesti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karlovonamesti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2155064ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2155064" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849">karlovonamesti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-13">05/13/24 18:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p><b>This should go without saying, but I wanted to mention this so those new to Creed can have a better experience:</b><br />
You can't just buy a Creed and start wearing it every day, expecting it to have good longevity and projection. Even now, long after the Creed family has divested from the business, it remains true: Creeds need time to macerate in-bottle.<br />
<br />
You buy it new. You wear it four or five times, lightly. Then you stow the bottle away for months. Many months, no fewer than six, and preferably eight or nine. Then you wear it again, once or twice. Stow it again for a few more months, two or three. By the time you get back to it on the third go-round, the perfume will have strengthened in both projection and tenacity, to the point where you may tire of it by the end of a long day. My F batch SMW was sujected to this rigor and now lasts seven hours, no problem. I've given it a couple months since the last wearing, and it will likely exceed eight hours next. <br />
<br />
Creeds were made to go the distance, but you have to know how to use them. Don't just buy it, spray it for a couple of weeks, and complain that it only lasts an hour. Of course it does. It was designed to macerate. You want to buy and spray with abandon? Buy CK One.<br />
<br />
<b>In response to the comment above:</b><br />
It is misleading to state that "maceration" would require solid particles in the solution. This refers to food/vegetal maceration, <i>not</i> perfumery maceration, which refers to perfume concentrate mixing and elaborating in a dispelling solution, i.e., alcohol and stabilizing solvents. This is a common mistake made by lay people in this discussion, where they equate obtaining the concentrate (also maceration) with the realization of a perfume in its functional solution. To quote the Journal of Chromatography A's 2010 publication of a paper by Marina Lpez-Nogueroles, Alberto Chisvert, and Amparo Salvador, titled <i>A Chromatochemometric Approach for Evaluating and Selecting the Perfume Maceration Time:</i><br />
<br />
Once the concentrate is obtained, it is mixed up with the other components that make part of the perfume, such as ethanol, water, antioxidants, UV filters and colouring agents among others. After the mixture has been elaborated it must be left some time, in which concentration changes in some components can occur due to the transference of insoluble substances from the concentrate to the solution or the precipitation of cerate components. These changes occur until a steady-state is achieved, in which the organoleptic characteristics of the whished perfume are obtained. This stage is known as the perfume maceration and it is carried out inside vats. Once the perfume maceration has concluded, the mixture is cooled and any sediment formed is removed by filtration. Finally, the perfume can be bottled and put on the market. It should be pointed out that the described perfume maceration process should not be confused with a procedure which is sometimes used for the obtaining of the concentrate also named maceration but referred to the raw material and not to the final product. <br />
<br />
Furthermore, this paper accidentally highlights why the Creed family (note that Im not including BlackRock and Kering in this) spent decades fibbing to the public about in-bottle maceration. The authors go on:<br />
<br />
Manufacturers usually use perfume maceration times of several weeks, even months, in order to assure that the process has been completed. This period frequently exceeds the time that would be really necessary to obtain the organoleptic characteristics of the wished perfume, since the steady-state is generally reached before. This carries important losses of time and its resulting economic cost as the perfumes remain in the vats of maceration for more time than is necessary before being packed and ready to put on the market. However, it should be mentioned that according to bibliographic databases, no papers about the study and/or the establishment of the perfumes maceration time are found.<br />
<br />
Thus it was profitable and commercially efficient for Creed to bottle perfumes that hadnt completed their maceration process in vats, and had not yet reached their full redolent potential, so to speak, which easily explains why Creeds would grow stronger after first use (it turns out it made them money to just pump freshly-mixed stuff into bottles to meet ever-increasing breakneck demand). <br />
<br />
Ive met a lot of anonymous perfumers and chemists in my years of writing about Creed. Few of them have any true knowledge of what theyre talking about when it comes to this brand. Even fewer are ever able to pen two or three sentences refuting the in-bottle maceration of Creeds without making obvious definitional errors that no true perfumer would make. <br />
<br />
A word of caution to readers: I dont include BlackRock and Kering in this discussion because to my knowledge the perfumes have been noticeably cheapened since the Creed family divested from the companys holdings and major operations, and its possible that an increase in synthetics, the removal of genuine ambergris, and a more conventional paint-by-numbers approach to perfume manufacturing has eliminated the overall impact of aging and intensifying Creeds after purchase and first use. However, I tend to stick to GIT and SMW, which were always super synthetic in nature, even going back 25 years, to more or less nullify any impact that the reformulation of Creed may have. So far my new bottle of SMW has been aging just fine, probably due to its not having been dramatically changed in the first place.<br />
<br />
In specific regards to SMW, while I own and enjoy it, I have to say that Club de Nuit Sillage by Armaf is, at the date of writing this piece, the better fragrance, far more complex and potent, and so ultimately if splitting hairs on maceration with this particular Creed, the whole thing has been rendered moot by a fairly renegade Saudi company that knows no shame and has gone straight for Creeds financial jugular. Ironically, Club de Nuit Sillage and Milestone both macerate in-bottle, just like their templates, and grow stronger and more complex over time.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2155064"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2155064#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2148542" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:1,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="1"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2148542" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JBob8979"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2124611"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="JBob8979" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2148542ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2148542" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2124611">JBob8979</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-07">05/07/24 10:22</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>As said down below. It smells like CK One. Big disappointment. I wouldnt pay over $30 for a full bottle of this. Actually I would probably buy the CK one instead of this lol. Sorry not sorry</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2148542"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2148542#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2148177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:5,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2148177" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="K&ouml;biD"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160015"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1160015.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="K&ouml;biD" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jousset-Parfums/Hypnotic-Leather-63364.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.63364.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Hypnotic Leather"title="Hypnotic Leather"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2148177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2148177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1160015">K&ouml;biD</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-07">05/07/24 01:50</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Mmmhh yes, this smells like well-blended quality ingredients! The first time I sprayed Silver Mountain Water, I was immediately taken back to the late 90s when I wore CK One. The similarities are undeniable, but Silver Mountain Water is more refined and smoother. <br />
I agree that the sillage seems to be weak, especially for the first 30 minutes. However, the longer I wear the fragrance, the more it seems to project and an aromatic greenness still radiates from my clothes the day after. This is a perfect fragrance for sunny spring days outdoors because it blends in so well with natures scents.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2148177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2148177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147973" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2147973" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="alialiok906"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110388"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="alialiok906" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2147973ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2147973" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2110388">alialiok906</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-06">05/06/24 20:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>It smells amazing one of the best summer fragrances</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2147973"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2147973#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2147925" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2147925" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ficusmuskus"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20453"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.20453.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ficusmuskus" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Couteau-de-Poche/Fumabat-46830.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.46830.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fumabat"title="Fumabat"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2147925ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2147925" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/20453">ficusmuskus</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-06">05/06/24 19:16</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>The current version being produced now is completely different from the original formula created by Pierre Bourdon. The current version is simply a pleasant fresh fragrance. The original formula was fresh, but also rich in berries, deep musk, and a hint of soft tobacco. I only have about 10ml left in my original bottle, and it's truly a beauty. It's saddening to know that it will never be produced again.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2147925"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2147925#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2146355" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2146355" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Huss_aladdin27"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2104829"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2104829.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Huss_aladdin27" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2146355ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2146355" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2104829">Huss_aladdin27</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-05">05/05/24 07:23</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>There is truly something about silver mountain water the scent is amazing very calming literally a banger for spring and sunny..Creed offers unique scents but unfortunately the projection longevity on their fragrances are underwhelming and the price point is overpriced this one is unique but you can go with better alternatives</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2146355"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2146355#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2145425" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2145425" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="MJPARKER"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2120656"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2120656.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="MJPARKER" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2145425ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2145425" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2120656">MJPARKER</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-04">05/04/24 08:35</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Love this fragrance. I made a vow to never blind buy another fragrance. Ordered a sample of SMW and was unsure at first. But within an hour or wearing it, I bought a full bottle. I have an F batch with a metal cap. The sample (unsure of the batch) seemed to be stronger. My current bottle becomes a skin scent around 2-4 hours. However, I do not care. SMW smells incredibly unique and fresh. To me, it is a perfect gym or run-around town fragrance. I get some citrus off the top, but settles quickly into a metallic &amp; green tea scent. It also gives me fresh laundry vibes. This would be my signature if it projected better. Even with a high price tag and middle-grade performance... this scent is wonderful and I will always have a bottle of this. <br />
<br />
PRICE: 6/10.  Bottle is great. The name has prestige. <br />
<br />
PERFORMANCE: 6/10. 2-3 feet projection. Skin scent 2-4 hours in. <br />
<br />
SCENT: 10/10. Unique. Elegant. Masculine without shouting.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2145425"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2145425#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2144580" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2144580" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="samuelares"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1582365"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1582365.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="samuelares" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mugler/A-Men-705.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.705.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="A*Men"title="A*Men"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2144580ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2144580" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1582365">samuelares</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-03">05/03/24 11:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If you don't like green tea notes then this is not for you. As 6jacob9 mentioned Cremo Silver water &amp; birch smells very close to it at a fraction of the price.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2144580"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2144580#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2143776" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2143776" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="umario"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1655168"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1655168.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="umario" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2143776ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2143776" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1655168">umario</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-05-02">05/02/24 16:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Just bought a vintage SMW bottle from 2003, sprayed my sample of the current formulation on my hand. What I say should be taken with a grain of salt considering 21 years is plenty of time for the molecules in my bottle to have gone bad, BUT the SMW of today is vastly different from what it used to be. Vintage SMW is much deeper - the tea is much stronger and prevalent. Current SMW is nice (I honestly might prefer it even), but much more citrus forward and much "cleaner", whereas vintage SMW is "sweeter". Longevity of old SMW isn't as nuclear as so many people say it is, but I would say that given how much deeper of a scent it is it does linger on the body a bit longer than new formulations. <br />
<br />
I'd say as it stands, the longevity of SMW makes it an absolutely terrible purchase, and would probably just recommend buying Armaf Sillage, or try out a vintage bottle if you can get your hands on one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2143776"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2143776#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2143603" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; Fresh mineralic tea citrusy and musky with a touch of woodyness. Longevity and projection is a bit weak, but this scent is so nice! Perfectly unisex without smelling "unisex"</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2143603"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2143603#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2141161" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2141161" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="axelsniff86"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2047209"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="axelsniff86" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Gisada/Ambassador-Intense-76636.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.76636.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ambassador Intense"title="Ambassador Intense"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2141161ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2141161" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2047209">axelsniff86</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-30">04/30/24 09:48</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very citrusy green fresh scent for me. I got a sample and used it for 2 consecutive days. The first day, even though i didn't smell at some point, I got a complimet that I left a nice scent trail. Second day i use it at work and got 2 compliments, 1 after 2 hours of applying, that they like the smell and then the other one after maybe 7 hours that it smells nice but at that point it was a lit more intimate. Definitely will buy a bottle when got a chance. But mostly for the aroma.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2141161"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2141161#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2138529" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2138529" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Luke.UK"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1650456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1650456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Luke.UK" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Yves-Saint-Laurent/La-Nuit-de-l-Homme-5521.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.5521.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="La Nuit de l'Homme"title="La Nuit de l'Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2138529ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2138529" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1650456">Luke.UK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-27">04/27/24 19:09</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This smells so clean in such an effortless way. Such a neutral, natural clean smell with a slight fruitiness to it; majority of people will probably assume you stepped out of the shower if you put this on. Sits closer to the skin but I wouldn't necessarily call it a skin scent.<br />
<br />
I think with it smelling so neutral it could be a downside to those looking for a compliment getting scent. If that's what  you're after you should probably skip this one.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2138529"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2138529#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2132744" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2132744" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="DistractedZach"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2077102"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.2077102.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="DistractedZach" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Lattafa-Perfumes/Ramz-Lattafa-Silver-71868.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.71868.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Ramz Lattafa Silver"title="Ramz Lattafa Silver"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2132744ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2132744" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2077102">DistractedZach</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-22">04/22/24 11:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>metallic, fresh, and a tiny bit fruity. WAYYY overpriced though</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2132744"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2132744#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2129859" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2129859" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="midget11"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1610562"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="midget11" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Carlisle-33514.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.33514.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Carlisle"title="Carlisle"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2129859ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2129859" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1610562">midget11</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-19">04/19/24 15:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>ONLY FRESH PERFUME I'LL PROBABLY EVER WEAR!!<br />
based on these reviews i probably just have shitty taste or am in denial but this is my fav from creed...i like the unisex silver freshness here, its pleasant, cool, not too masculine at all, and rather abstract vibes which I love; This is great in spring/summer and just feels so androgynous and laid back, it makes me feel like a cool girl. The first time i smelt it i went home and SERIOUSLY considered buying the 500ml decant bc I was like yeah I could wear this all the time...I dont mind the moderate performance and dont mind respraying every couple hours cuz i carry perfume wit me anyway, we obvs expect better performance for this price but I'm coping cuz I like the scent that much haha...the club de nuit dupe is FAR better in terms of performance and more masculine, so I would just buy that if i were a guy. But as a girl i like this and infact need it bc I wear cold-season heavy-hitters on a daily basis (even in summer yes im psycho) and this is the only "fresh" scent i have ever liked on myself in my conscious adult life; most definitely the only one ive actually considered wearing out. I'm used to smelling consistently strong and pungent all day long and i think this being a moderate-performance freshie is a nice and necessary refreshing change for me and people around me...its also not THAAAT soft or intimate, it does project like an average fresh perfume for like 3/4 hours before becoming softer- this is hardly a problem for me bc i respray myself often anyway even with strong perfumes</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2129859"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2129859#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123761" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2123761" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="maddieonline"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1719117.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="maddieonline" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2123761ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2123761" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.71); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1719117">maddieonline</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-13">04/13/24 12:56</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is nice, but in the same way an Axe deodorant is? It's interesting - it's sharp and screechy in the opening but as it settles it's a lot better. It projects well, i.e. just more than an arm's length, and the longevity on this is crazy. In the dry-down I can kind of smell the tea, but honestly I cannot identify one singular note in this purely from sniffing it. I like it and it definitely leans more masculine, but for this price it's not the most unique or complex fragrance I've ever smelled. I don't like it enough to buy a bottle and certainly not at this price point, but it's decent.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2123761"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2123761#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2123417" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.8);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1727971">TaeBKK</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-05">04/05/24 03:58</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To me, it smells exactly like Mefisto, which I'd rather buy instead. Each to their own, but I dislike Creed and the direction the company is going (cash grab), and would rather not support them.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2114915"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2114915#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2114159" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2114159" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jokcoy"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1524392"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1524392.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jokcoy" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Tom-Ford/Black-Orchid-1018.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.1018.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Black Orchid"title="Black Orchid"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2114159ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2114159" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.74); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1524392">jokcoy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2024-04-04">04/04/24 09:52</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Citrus in the opening is threw me off and too much. I don't really like citrusy scent so it's biased. The dry down is way better. with tea like scent and a bit of metallic scent. The musky and woody give a nice touch. The dry down is very pleasant. If only I have the option to skip the opening, that would be great. good projection and rather okay longevity. The price tho, nah.... just go with the clone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2114159"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2114159#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2112032" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2112032" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bigreddal"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/2078175"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bigreddal" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2112032ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2112032" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.79); Strong citrus opening that dries down to green tea. Doesn't smell unique or too interesting, but that might be a plus for most people. A simple fresh scent done very well. Would never pay full price for it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2112032"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2112032#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2109940" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
