Although overpriced for its power and only lasting on me a max 3 hours it's still an unremarkable fragrance I would recommend to anyone that needs a freshie. However, it's better to bring a little decant with you.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2012115"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2012115#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2010368" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2010368" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Jesse&#039;s Fragrances"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889616"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1889616.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Jesse&#039;s Fragrances" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Michael-Malul-London/511-Black-Tie-64954.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64954.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="511 Black Tie"title="511 Black Tie"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2010368ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2010368" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1889616">Jesse&#039;s Fragrances</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-25">12/25/23 12:49</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Another great perfume by Creed! It starts with green tea, then a little bergamot with citrus. The only gripe I have about it is it doesnt last as long as other Creed fragrances. I would wear it everyday only if it lasted longer.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2010368"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2010368#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2007513" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2007513" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sarahlage"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614575"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1614575.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sarahlage" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Giorgio-Armani/Si-Passione-48002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="S Passione"title="S Passione"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2007513ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2007513" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.85); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1614575">sarahlage</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-21">12/21/23 19:44</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Oh, I adore this cologne! Its so bright and fresh; thats the only way I can describe it! It is citrusy, yet cool and very masculine at the same time. The dry down is a warmer unisex skin scent with hints of sandalwood. Simply invigorating and perfect from start to finish!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2007513"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2007513#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent2007130" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc2007130" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Gray Huska"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1934870"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1934870.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Gray Huska" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma2007130ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd2007130" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1934870">Gray Huska</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-21">12/21/23 11:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I still remember walking into Harry Rosen in the Rideau Center (Ottawa, Canada) after they updated their store &amp; seeing this line of flask-shaped bottles &amp; being curious as to what they were. "Creed". Bottle by bottle, I checked the whole line up and found myself very fond of almost the entire line. But on that day, one stood out from all the rest, Silver Mountain Water - I knew it was for me. At that time I was 15. I was just getting into understanding style &amp; fragrances. I had a job like most high schoolers &amp; bought myself a spring/summer fragrance (Prada Luna Rosa) &amp; a fall/winter one (Tom Ford Noir). After seeing the price tag of $350 CAD for 120ml, I knew I couldn't afford it. For my 16th birthday, I didn't ask for a car - I asked for a bottle of Silver Mountain Water.<br />
<br />
Now, i'm 25. I have owned every Creed I wanted as well as many other fragrances, both niche and designer. Most of them I never repurchased, ended up selling, or giving to friends. With Silver Mountain Water, I have gone through 3 120ml/100ml bottles &amp; 1 250ml flacon.<br />
<br />
While some people say its over priced, its performance is lacking, I personally don't feel the same. I buy it discounted from Fragrance Buy now, but if I couldn't - I'd still pay full retail for it. On my skin, this lasts 7+ hours. While I might not be able to smell it after 3-4 hours, other people have complimented me after a full day of wear. Aside from the stellar performance on my skin, I find this to be one of the most unique "safe" fragrances in production today. The mixture of tea, citrus, and musk in this scent is so well executed &amp; blended to perfection. I also love how since Creed has become more well known in the past 9 years in the mainstream,  Aventus is what most non-fragrance enthusiasts gravitate towards so I don't smell like everyone else even though more people are familiar with the brand - I smell like me.<br />
<br />
Silver Mountain Water is "My" fragrance &amp; always will be. If it ever becomes discontinued, I plan to buy 10+ bottles so I never have to live without it.<br />
<br />
11/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="2007130"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=2007130#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1999728" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1999728" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="tab369"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1922308"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1922308.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="tab369" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Royal-Oud-12317.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12317.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Royal Oud"title="Royal Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1999728ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1999728" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1922308">tab369</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-12">12/12/23 17:38</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I can see where this may not be for everyone, especially in the niche category its super light. Its chilling, to me the best way to describe it (and its not even a description really) is this what I imagine Jack Frost would wear. Its just bright but fills your nose with almost a light effervescent feeling rather than a really forward projecting scent. Its tough because I really do enjoy the scent but I dont really enjoy the price point.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1999728"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1999728#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997734" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997734" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Siv7Stars"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47621"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.47621.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Siv7Stars" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jovoy-Paris/Fire-At-Will-70289.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.70289.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Fire At Will"title="Fire At Will"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997734ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997734" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.86); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/47621">Siv7Stars</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 11:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I've tried this a few times (shop tester bottle, in a shop), recalling it was supposedly worn by Bowie, &amp; someone once said he was the most incredible smelling person they'd ever met. Well he cant've been wearing this when they met. To me it's like being bonked on the head with a giant tuning fork. There is nothing pleasant here to my nose, or my trigeminal nerve. By turns acrid n metallic n just plain horrid, I can only advise never blind buying. Tea as tannin soup, with sour lemons, unripe blackberry, with a pinch of pure spite. Unfathomable. The notes are boink, twang, ow. Pink donkey notwithstanding. </p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1997734"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1997734#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1997711" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1997711" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="hanif999"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1724577"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="hanif999" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Parfums-de-Marly/Layton-39314.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.39314.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Layton"title="Layton"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1997711ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1997711" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1724577">hanif999</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-10">12/10/23 10:29</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Very fresh, clean and appealing! When I first smelt this it reminded me of CK one. Even though they smell different, theres a similarity to its clean, fresh element of the fragrance. Although this would work better during the warmer months, i still think this can still be worn during winter and autumn. If anything, the fragrance reminded me of a cold environment, like on top of a snowy mountain. There are many clones out there that smells similar and that is wayyy cheaper (for example, armaf club de nuit sillage) but non of them smells as good as creed silver mountain water.<br />
<br />
The fragrance is more on the subtle side rather than a loud fragrance, but not as subtle as millesime imperial.<br />
<br />
I tend to wear this if im wearing a clean, soft, white and premium clothes during the day as it suits the vibes!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1997711"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1997711#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1992710" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1992710" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Bregondo"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1593456"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1593456.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Bregondo" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Antonio-Banderas/The-Icon-64487.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.64487.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="The Icon"title="The Icon"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1992710ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1992710" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1593456">Bregondo</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-12-04">12/04/23 22:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Beautiful effervescent opening that unfortunately dissipates after 5 minutes or maybe even less. Projection of around 3-4 feet for maybe 10 minutes. It quickly sits close to the skin, and stays as a soft faint skin scent for 6 hours.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1992710"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1992710#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1987751" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1987751" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="karlovonamesti"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.19849.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="karlovonamesti" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1987751ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1987751" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/19849">karlovonamesti</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-28">11/28/23 20:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wore this one again recently. It's changed from past years, but not by much. I only have prior experience with SMW dating back to between 2011 and 2013. Back then it read to me as a sweet berry fragrance with a bit of transparent citrus on top, very sheer and quite hard to detect. Today it smells like a somewhat metallic citrus, mostly sweet mandarin and aromatic bergamot notes that are intertwined to form that familiar opening, surprisingly in league with most of the clones out there in terms of quality. Only difference with SMW is it's definitely a bit smoother than most of the other stuff, at least in the first fifteen minutes. But current formula dries down to a relatively plain "ink" note of blackcurrant and what smells a bit like black tea, mated to a thin white musk. To be honest, Sillage is deeper, more robust, and also features the exact same blackcurrant and tea effect in the drydown, with less white musk and more Ambroxan. I would own SMW just to say I have it, but would probably wear Sillage more.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1987751"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1987751#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1979489" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1979489" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Fountain30"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521681"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Fountain30" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1979489ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1979489" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1521681">Fountain30</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-18">11/18/23 08:57</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Nothing in a bottle</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1979489"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1979489#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1977339" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1977339" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="mikebardenpiano"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853829"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1853829.gif" class="comments-avatar"alt="mikebardenpiano" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Dior/Sauvage-Eau-de-Parfum-48100.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.48100.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Sauvage Eau de Parfum"title="Sauvage Eau de Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1977339ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1977339" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.75); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1853829">mikebardenpiano</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-15">11/15/23 11:36</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Despite the rave reviews from so many people, this one is just painful for me, like an cold icepick up the nose. Fragrances are truly subjective, you just have to see for yourself how it works for you, and I am thinking this is just not for me. I might try it again in warm weather, but for now I'm afraid it's a nope.<br />
<br />
Update: Well, I have adjusted to this and am finding it very pleasant now instead of harsh. And I got a full bottle - yes, that's quite the turnaround for me. I already have Armoff Sillage but the SMW is clearly higher quality. I'm mixed on the performance issue. One day I wore it for work and I could continue to smell it throughout the day, then another day I tried the same and it seemed to die off too quickly. So my feelings about it are still a little mixed but I do appreciate the scent much more now, and kind of love it.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1977339"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1977339#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1974166" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1974166" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="leonardwashington"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826154"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1826154.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="leonardwashington" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.472.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Silver Mountain Water"title="Silver Mountain Water"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1974166ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1974166" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1826154">leonardwashington</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-11">11/11/23 11:18</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This was my very first niche Ive ever purchased. Ive read reviews on Creed not being the Creed it use to be but I took a chance anyway. Ive heard some much about the creed brand and always wanted to try Creed. After doing some research between the best Creed to get for appeal to the opposite sex(women). I came across Silver Mountain Water(SMW). A lot of people say Aventus is the best Creed. I came across YouTuber Melissa National(hope I spelled her name right). She made a video how Aventus is a boxer dropper while SMW is a panty dropper. Me personally I enjoy wearing fragrances that are sexy/date night appeal. Along with other women saying they think SMW is just super sexy smelling compared to Aventus. So I gave it a buy. When wearing SMW I must say its definitely very very very !!! Even though I enjoy sexy/date night fragrances. I enjoy fresh/airy smelling fragrances. Its something about fragrances that smells Airy that really triggers a feel good kind of feeling to me. SMW is very fresh, airy, mountain, cold and watery smell. Thats the best way I can describe it. There is a Green Tea note. Which I think that gives it the smoothness. I could be wrong Im no expert. Yes it does have a clean metallic/inky texture to it but I absolutely dont mind it because it seems like its only in the opening of the fragrance. I absolutely love SMW. It doesnt last too long but I think it could be were wearing it in the wrong season let me explain. <br />
<br />
Its been ideally a spring/summer fragrance because of its a freshly. I read about people experiencing with fragrances on Reddit. This guy said hes been wearing this fragrance since it came out in the 90s. Said to him this really shines for him during the colder months. Then it click for me. When reading this description for this fragrance. Oliver Creed said this fragrance was made in remembrance of Skiing on the Alpine Alps. Where its cold, snowy, and mountainous. It clicked for me to give this a shot when its cold  out as a freshie. So Im give it a go. <br />
<br />
Overrall SMW I think is the only Creed Ill keep in my collection. I really enjoy that fresh, metallic, herbal, airy smell. Also women love it and I do too. It last about 6-8hours on me and Im little heavy on the sprays with this. But this has become my first signature scent on my new fragrance journey.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1974166"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1974166#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1972472" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1972472" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="brcamp13"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813662"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="brcamp13" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1972472ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1972472" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1813662">brcamp13</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-09">11/09/23 08:27</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is the best smelling fragrance in my personal opinion. Its a shame it doesnt last long, but its more stomachable when youve purchased it at 50%+ off via discounters or Costco. <br />
<br />
Its difficult to pick out notes, and its overall just pleasant and heavenly. Not heavy, not offensive. Just amazing.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1972472"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1972472#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1971255" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1971255" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Owen Witabi"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683830"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1683830.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Owen Witabi" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Louis-Vuitton/Pacific-Chill-81423.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.81423.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Pacific Chill"title="Pacific Chill"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1971255ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1971255" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1683830">Owen Witabi</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-07">11/07/23 17:11</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Great fragrance. There's a note in this that I'm not fond of but overall really enjoy the profile, the more I wear it. Surprisingly long lasting, and can picture getting choked out if over spraying close to nose area. One of the only perfumes my dad enjoys and doesn't find to be a synthetic mess.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1971255"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1971255#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1970074" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1970074" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Tony Shades"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1029609"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1029609.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Tony Shades" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Rochas/Moustache-Original-1949-52351.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52351.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Moustache Original 1949"title="Moustache Original 1949"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1970074ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1970074" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.73); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1029609">Tony Shades</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-06">11/06/23 11:21</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is one of the weirdest combos ever, just like Erba Pura. It's a fruity musky ambrox something in which everything seems to clash with each other. Absolutely unwearable to me.<br />
However, people who like fresh synthetic fruity bombs like Erba Pura and such will probably enjoy this one too. Good luck with it!</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1970074"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1970074#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1969973" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;want&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1969973" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="ginandrice"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1246357.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="ginandrice" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Oud-Satin-Mood-30352.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.30352.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Satin Mood"title="Oud Satin Mood"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1969973ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1969973" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.7); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1246357">ginandrice</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-06">11/06/23 09:25</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A nuanced and sophisticated fresh scent that impressively realizes its name. <br />
<br />
Tangy, musky, and aromatic, with a great mineral freshness to it. <br />
<br />
It opens with a zing of citrusmostly bergamot, not very sweetbefore drying down into tangy green tea and airy-sweet muskiness.<br />
<br />
It really does evoke the subtle mineral "sweetness" of icy-cold, fresh mountain water that's run itself clean over miles and miles of rocks and stones.<br />
<br />
Spring is my least favorite season, especially living in a city where springtime means endless cold and rain. But Silver Mountain Water makes me want to embrace the springmakes me want to lace up my sneakers and go for a morning jog; let the rain and the cold air wake me up.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1969973"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1969973#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1966920" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1966920" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="dayonee"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647189"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1647189.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="dayonee" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Allure-Homme-Sport-Eau-Extreme-14669.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.14669.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme"title="Allure Homme Sport Eau Extreme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1966920ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1966920" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1647189">dayonee</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-11-02">11/02/23 12:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I'm a huge fan of fresh, citrusy, smooth scents so this is right up my alley. Very nicely done. One of the reviews stated that it smells like heaven, and I get it. I imagine a cupid smelling like this, sitting on a cloud eating a citrus fruit. To my nose, PdM Sedley has a similar vibe but that is a bit more sharp and bright. Relatively, SMW is more smooth and muskier. Nothing groundbreaking and some may even find it boring but no one around you will be offended by this. So easy to wear, refreshing, and comforting. Not worth the retail, though. Get it discounted.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1966920"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1966920#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1963946" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%;
