padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1701040">stardust_ziggy</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-20">08/20/23 06:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Wow this is a 10/10 scent, my gosh. Every time I wear it Im reminded how great it is. This is not a challenging scent nor statement scent but it is unique and smells like quality ingredients were used. <br />
<br />
This is refined. Its very safe but not generic. The tea and currant can smell floral but its really not. <br />
<br />
Sample first because its expensive. Performance is poor so if you like the scent and cheaper raw materials wont bother those around you get CDNS as its maybe 1/10 of the price and does have good performance. <br />
<br />
Scent 10/10<br />
Price to performance 4/10</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1906797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1906797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1904599" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;female_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1904599" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Maestrinho"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816999"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="Maestrinho" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1904599ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1904599" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1816999">Maestrinho</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-17">08/17/23 12:42</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells weak and diluted, at least on me (gone in 90 minutes).<br />
<br />
A unisex frag that Id say leans definitely more towards women (the same way Royal Water leans definitely towards men). A bit like a sweet and fruity GIT..?</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1904599"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1904599#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899878" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899878" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="iamwntr"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1445999"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1445999.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="iamwntr" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899878ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899878" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1445999">iamwntr</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 16:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This! Silver Mountain Water to this day remains the best Creed fragrance, the smell is so intoxicatingly fresh, deep and crisp. <br />
<br />
I find myself wearing this more in winter, it's a fruity green fragrance but a cold crisp one at that, some people say it smelly inky and I can kind of pick that up, an almost green sparkly ink.<br />
<br />
Performance is fair and good and generally not an issue unlike the whole ridiculous Aventus batches thing.<br />
<br />
10/10 a classic</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1899878"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1899878#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1899797" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:3,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1899797" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="JusttheFactsMan"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1733487.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="JusttheFactsMan" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Le-Male-Le-Parfum-61856.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61856.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Le Male Le Parfum"title="Le Male Le Parfum"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1899797ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1899797" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(248,249,236,0.78); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1733487">JusttheFactsMan</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-11">08/11/23 14:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>#209 in my "Tour de Fragrance"<br />
<br />
I like the scent, especially the opening that is shrill and impressive, but unfortunately for the brand there is a passable dupe in Club de Nuit Sillage that matches up well for $30. So, you have to pass this by just on principle. Then there's the mediocre performance, average at best. <br />
<br />
I see a lot of complaints that Creed's reformulations are disappointing. I don't know not having used the pre-2016 versions, but it seems the Arab scent makers like Armaf are eating their breakfast, lunch and dinner because the latest Creed versions are deemed poor performers by long-term clients who are giving the brand a ton of bad word-of-mouth.<br />
<br />
No one has to put up with poor performance in this high price range. When I buy MFK Grand Soir or PDM Pegasus I absolutely get my money's worth. They aren't just great scents, but I put them on at 7AM and I can go straight from a late day at the office to dinner with a date and the scent is still performing. This Creed scent doesn't have anything like that endurance. I expect to respray at lunch if it's a scent that's under $50, but not one that's $250 for a 100ml bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1899797"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1899797#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898296" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:2,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1898296" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="magicto123"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811651"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="magicto123" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1898296ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1898296" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.88); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1811651">magicto123</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 21:39</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I received a 2 ml sample and used it for 3 days. <br />
<br />
However, the fragrance only carries a musky and powdery scent, rather than the spectrum of ingredients it claims to have. Strangely, I couldn't detect the middle notes at all. The scent would appear intermittently, linger for just a few seconds, and disappointingly vanish within two hours.<br />
<br />
I had to sniff my wrist closely to catch its elusive presence. To enhance its projection, it needs to be mixed with other matching scented lotions. However, some people claim that doing so would ruin its heavenly scent, which, to be honest, I couldn't perceive. Therefore, it's advisable to use it in a solitary or less crowded environment to prevent other slightly stronger odors from overshadowing it.<br />
<br />
The monotonous scent and underwhelming longevity were certainly not worth the high price and didn't live up to the reputation of the brand. It was a major letdown, as there are undoubtedly much cheaper alternatives available.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1898296"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1898296#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1898187" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:1,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:1,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1898187" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RawSmells"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1384192"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1384192.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RawSmells" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-EAUX-Primordiales/Oud-Superfluide-55303.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.55303.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Oud Superfluide"title="Oud Superfluide"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1898187ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck1x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1898187" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1384192">RawSmells</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-09">08/09/23 18:08</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Looking at the Pros it seems Im of the minority that likens this to Millesime Imperial? Either way I think its lovely, and so is Millesime Imperial.  <br />
<br />
With SMW on my left arm, and Millesime Imperial on my right, they are ever so similar, but NOW with both being compared from the opening onwards, I can so smell the melon in SMW, and MI smells so aquatic, to me those are the main two comparisons.  If you love one, there is no doubt you will love the other, unless you are averse to Melon.  The Melon is so obvious now that I compare the two.  SMW on it's own, I could not detect Melon at all, but now I so do.  I think I'm leaning more towards MI...<br />
<br />
I have reached to the conclusion as I believe most of us should; if you enjoy Creed fragrances and appreciate them for what they are, then as part and parcel of their fragrance experience is their pathetic performance and longevity. If the latter two negative aspects are taken into consideration and accepted, then you may start to realise how gorgeous they are.  Its a bit like having a great friend, but they have a some annoying habits, and once accepted as the whole package, they can become your absolute best friend, and I believe the same applies with Creed.<br />
<br />
SMW is stunning, it reminds me too much of Milliseme Imperial, but with the Melon twist, it has similar performance but a bit better.  I cant say there is a Creed that I dislike, its just the price Vs performance thats painful.  Its such a fresh and addictive smell, I paid 135 for 50ml, and that is just about right for the gorgeous smell.  I'm definitely leaning towards MI, but if you smell SMW on it's own, I don't think you could really perceive a difference, except, the 'there's something different than MI' feeling.<br />
<br />
There are very good dupes of SMW and MI, and if you are happy with the Creed dupes, then go for it, I seriously doubt anyone else will notice they are dupes, because after all everyones body chemistry is different, but for me, (and this is me), in my own humble personal opinion, I love what I smell, and be it psychosomatic or not, I notice a Creed dupe _on_ me, and I can smell how smoother Creed is, does it warrant the difference in price? For me, yes, for anyone else? Well thats where the beauty of our hobby resides, its completely subjective. If you wore a good Creed dupe, would I notice? Probably not, so the bottom line is I'm wearing it for *me*.<br />
<br />
Irrespective if you enjoy this one or a dupe, just go and enjoy it.  Life is too short to argue who has a bigger wallet to accommodate one purchase over another, enjoy your 25 dupe or your 250 Creed, it matters not, what matters is if it makes you smile, and what makes you happy, makes those that surround you happy, dont let any review or anyone tell you otherwise :)<br />
<br />
Enjoy your frags, enjoy your loved ones and most importantly go enjoy life, and God bless you all :-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1898187"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1898187#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1891865" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:0,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1891865" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Cinimod1"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244121"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1244121.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Cinimod1" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Gentle-Fluidity-Gold-53401.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.53401.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Gentle Fluidity Gold"title="Gentle Fluidity Gold"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1891865ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck0x0"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1891865" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.82); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1244121">Cinimod1</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-08-01">08/01/23 11:19</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Smells EXACTLY like the tin foil off a fresh pack of cigarettes. If you disagree.....you're wrong lol. I'm a child of the 70s and 80s.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1891865"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1891865#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1891401" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:4,&quot;winter&quot;:1,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;male_unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1891401" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="SeeMGRun"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1804979"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1804979.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="SeeMGRun" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1891401ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck2x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1891401" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.72); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1804979">SeeMGRun</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2023-07-31">07/31/23 17:55</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Used a 10mL sample of this for about a month. Something about the scent was very icy/crisp, which I weirdly felt actually worked well for winter use. Fresh but not really in a linen/out of the shower way, more just clean and musky. I wouldn't purchase this considering the price point, but overall a pretty good frag.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1891401"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1891401#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="472" sentiment="all"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-positive-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Positive Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent355701" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc355701" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Rich28"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18295"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.18295.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Rich28" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Mancera/Intense-Cedrat-Boise-72796.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.72796.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Intense Cedrat Boise"title="Intense Cedrat Boise"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma355701ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck7x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd355701" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.81); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/18295">Rich28</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-04-12">04/12/13 11:28</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>My experience after my first wearing of Creed's SMW. A play about a fragrance <br />
by: Rich28 <br />
<br />
Chapter I.<br />
It's late evening and I just opened and sniffed my bottle of SMW.<br />
<br />
Rich to Sister: "Smell this" (sprays sister)<br />
Sister: (Smells wrist) "Hmmm...this smells goooood, I'd wear it! It's light and resembles Millesime Imperial."<br />
Rich: "It does"<br />
Sister: (cheeky smile on her face),"You could give it to me like you did MI if you don't like."<br />
Rich: Ahhhh...no...I'll be hanging on to this one.<br />
<br />
Chapter II.<br />
An hour later.<br />
<br />
Rich to Brother: "smell this" (sprays wrist) <br />
Brother: (sniffs wrist then looks at me with eyes open wide) "This one is exactly my style, what's it called?"<br />
Rich: "Silver Mountain Water by Creed"<br />
Brother: "Of all the fragrances you own, this one is the best I've smelt so far" <br />
<br />
Chapter III.<br />
The following day on my way to work with a coworker, nearly 2hrs after application. <br />
<br />
Rich to Female Coworker#1: (At traffic light) "Smell this"<br />
Female Coworker #1: (Sniffs arm)"Hmmmmm"...(grabs arm for a second sniff)"smells really good...Smells like a female could wear too"<br />
Rich: "Yeah, it does...it's very unisex I think."<br />
<br />
Chapter IV.<br />
Mid morning (approx 10am.)at the office.<br />
<br />
Female Coworker #2: (Passes me standing by the cubicle of another coworker chatting.) "Somebody smells really good." (she looks at me then says) "it's you"  <br />
Rich: (chuckles and says nothing) <br />
Female Coworker #2: (sits at her cubicle) Hmmm...(shakes head obviously in appreciation of the fragrance) "That fragrance smells really nice."<br />
Rich: (liking the attention, yet a bit self conscious) "Thanks" <br />
<br />
Chapter V.<br />
Conclusion after one day of wearing SMW. <br />
<br />
Of all the fragrances I own, SMW wins the prize for soliciting the most emphatic compliment I've ever gotten. When your coworker reacts positively to your fragrance to the point where you begin to feel unconfortable, that's gotta say something.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="355701"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=355701#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent329177" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc329177" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jht4060"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/327868"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.327868.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jht4060" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Hermes/Terre-d-Hermes-17.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.17.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Terre d'Herms"title="Terre d'Herms"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma329177ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd329177" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,245,242,0.79); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/327868">jht4060</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-01-26">01/26/13 12:53</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I join the chorus of praises for this remarkable scent. A spring day high in the Alps next to a rushing stream. It is so well crafted that it is hard to pick out the notes, and I prefer not to - it isn't bergamot, green tea, marine, silvery metal, and white musk, it is a mood, an attitude, an evocation. Silver Mountain Water makes me want to spin through a high meadow, arms stretched out, and burst into song as I crest the hill.<br />
<br />
Added later - Luca Turin (coauthor of the turgid and pretentious "Perfumes: the A-Z guide) hates Silver Mountain Water (and misquotes the price). This alone is reason enough to buy it. :-)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="329177"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=329177#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent121080" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc121080" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="RIVI1969"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37906"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.37906.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="RIVI1969" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Montblanc/Explorer-52002.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.52002.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Explorer"title="Explorer"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma121080ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd121080" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(250,247,236,0.9); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/37906">RIVI1969</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2011-01-12">01/12/11 17:05</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>If anyone has read or seen the movie "The Perfume" might remember the part where Master Baldini smells the perfume that Grenouille had created for him when they first met. He opens the bottle, smells the aroma, and suddenly everything around him is transformed into a beautiful flower garden, then a woman slowly approaches him and says to his ear: "I love you" This is one of the few perfumes that when I first smelled it literally made me feel that way... For a few seconds I thought I was in heaven. <br />
<br />
Beyond notes, duration, longevity or sillage, this perfume is just wonderful. My all time favorite.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="121080"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=121080#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent408037" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc408037" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Houdini4"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.607493.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Houdini4" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Les-Indemodables/Vanille-Havane-Coeur-de-Oud-96892.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.96892.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"title="Vanille Havane Coeur de Oud"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma408037ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck6x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd408037" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.77); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/607493">Houdini4</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-09-19">09/19/13 17:51</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>This is HEAVENLY!!! Fruity berries, with musk behind and you get the hint of tea too!<br />
Simply stunning, spellbinding freshness... Definitely evokes the fresh mountain stream.<br />
I was reluctant to blind buy as I'd read reviews that it was a disappointing effort from Creed... And similar to Himalaya (which it really isn't)<br />
 My personal taste says this is my favourite from the house and I must have it!<br />
Just reaffirms in my mind that you should always try a fragrance (of course) and that there's no accounting for taste.<br />
One thing I've learned is that Creed is synonymous with quality.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="408037"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=408037#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent378292" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:5,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc378292" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="jhitt793"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/220488"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.220488.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="jhitt793" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/L-Homme-A-la-Rose-61779.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.61779.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="L'Homme  la Rose"title="L'Homme  la Rose"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma378292ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd378292" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.76); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/220488">jhitt793</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2013-06-18">06/18/13 20:45</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>A fragrance masterpiece.  The inclusion of green tea and black currant a stroke of genius.  Upon first smelling this fragrance I could have sworn floral notes were included in the ingredients though there are none.  Makes me imagine the trickling of melting snow as the first flowers of spring burst through the ice and into the warming sun.  One of my absolute favorites from Creed. (9)</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="378292"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=378292#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div>                            <reviews-infinity :random-colors="[&quot;#fefcee&quot;,&quot;#faf7ec&quot;,&quot;#f9f9f3&quot;,&quot;#f8f9ec&quot;,&quot;#fffdea&quot;,&quot;#faf9fb&quot;,&quot;#faf5f2&quot;,&quot;#f7f4f2&quot;]" :perfume-id="472" sentiment="positive"></reviews-infinity>
            </div>
</div>
</div><div class="tabs-panel" id="popular-negative-reviews"><div class="cell">
    <div class="strike-title"><span>Most Popular Negative Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="grid-x grid-padding-x grid-margin-y" style="position: relative; padding: 0 0.25rem 0 0.25rem;">
                            <div id="parent78952" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc78952" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="sherapop"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.17027.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="sherapop" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Chanel/Chanel-No-5-L-Eau-38543.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.38543.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"title="Chanel No 5 L'Eau"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma78952ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck5x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd78952" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(255,253,234,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/17027">sherapop</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2010-05-02">05/02/10 20:10</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>To my nose, Creed SILVER MOUNTAIN WATER bears a remarkable similarity to the openings of Moschino CHEAP &amp; CHIC and OH! Some serious organic chemistry synthesis has gone into this little test tube, er, vial. <br />
<br />
Not my cup of tea, although tea is apparently a note in this composition, along with others which I usually like. I just find that the overwhelmingly synthetic quality drowns out the natural notes. It's all too cold and forbidding. Not really masculine; not really feminine. It's so uninviting that I would label it asexual. Might be related structurally to some of the Calvin Klein liquids sold in gallon jugs and marketed as uni-frags to "modern" couples who dress only in black and white. <br />
<br />
SILVER MOUNTAIN WATER reminds me a bit of shiny chrome kitchen appliances: interesting to look at from a distance, prefer not to touch. Definitely do not want them in my home.<br />
<br />
SILVER MOUNTAIN WATER reminds me of Splenda. Or Nutrasweet. Or Saccharin. Or Cyclamates. (I really prefer sugar.)<br />
<br />
SILVER MOUNTAIN WATER is cubic zirconium. Or cut glass.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="78952"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=78952#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent888090" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:0,&quot;sillage&quot;:0,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;had&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc888090" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="Laurdess"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/719382"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.719382.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="Laurdess" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Maison-Francis-Kurkdjian/Aqua-Universalis-Forte-12710.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.12710.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Aqua Universalis Forte"title="Aqua Universalis Forte"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma888090ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x2"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd888090" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(254,252,238,0.89); Here goes nothing... (Literally) <br />
This SO good but doesn't last. Kind of like a Navy ship pulling into port. Wahoooooo- Gone.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="888090"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=888090#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1423913" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:1,&quot;sillage&quot;:1,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:&quot;have&quot;}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1423913" class="cell small-2" sticky-container><div v-sticky><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="antibrand"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307755"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="antibrand" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1423913ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck4x1"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1423913" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"sticky-container><div class="flex-child-shrink" v-sticky style="background: rgba(247,244,242,0.83); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1307755">antibrand</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-10-07">10/07/21 06:59</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>Anything creed made post 2016 is diluted, reformulated and laughable.  This used to be such a unique scent.  The longevity is pathetic.  Armaf sillage is the closest thing you can get to what the millesime version was.  People are getting wise to this, and creed should be hanging their heads in shame.  <br />
<br />
The original was rich and full, but still a fresh scent.  It had the olfactory effect of watching mercury and snow in the sunlight, along with a cold air accord. <br />
<br />
The alpine and silver effect is gone in new formulations.  Its now a spicy bergamot with a small amount of synthetic bergamot.  It doesnt even last an hour.  Thumbs up to the original.  Face palm to the current version.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1423913"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1423913#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent1472794" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:0,&quot;summer&quot;:0,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:0,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:4,&quot;sillage&quot;:2,&quot;gender&quot;:&quot;unisex&quot;,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc1472794" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="piacrdn"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426062"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/avatari/m.1426062.jpg" class="comments-avatar"alt="piacrdn" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"><span class="idLinkify" title="/perfume/Jean-Paul-Gaultier/Scandal-Pour-Homme-68074.html"><img loading="lazy" src="https://fimgs.net/mdimg/perfume/mm.68074.jpg"class="perfume-wearing-icon" alt="Scandal Pour Homme"title="Scandal Pour Homme"></span></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma1472794ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd1472794" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(249,249,243,0.89); padding: 0.2rem;"><p><b class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/1426062">piacrdn</b><span class="vote-button-legend" style="padding: 0 1rem;" itemprop="datePublished" content="2021-12-29">12/29/21 18:34</span></p></div><div class="flex-child-auto" style="position: relative;"><div v-pre itemprop="reviewBody"><p>I think I'm not a fan of the one dimensional citrus opening BUT I can't stop sniffing it. Lovely dose of green tea, black currant, &amp; that floral musk base. SMW would make for a lovely spring-summer spritz if you do decide to purchase a full bottle.</p></div></div><div class="flex-child-shrink"><div style="display:flex; align-items: baseline;"><vote-buttons initial_status="neutral" item_id="472"comment_id="1472794"vote_for="perfumeReview"></vote-buttons><share path="/perfume/Creed/Silver-Mountain-Water-472.html?ccid=1472794#focus-zone"></share></div></div></div></div></div><div id="parent399892" class="cell fragrance-review-box" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9);" itemprop="review" itemtype="http://schema.org/Review" itemscope><div style="display: flex;flex-wrap: wrap;justify-content: end;position: relative"><user-perfume-votes :perfume-votes="{&quot;rating&quot;:2,&quot;winter&quot;:0,&quot;spring&quot;:1,&quot;summer&quot;:1,&quot;autumn&quot;:0,&quot;day&quot;:1,&quot;night&quot;:0,&quot;longevity&quot;:3,&quot;sillage&quot;:3,&quot;gender&quot;:null,&quot;relation&quot;:null}"><div itemprop="reviewRating" itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating" itemscope><meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="2"/><meta itemprop="bestRating" content="5"/></div></user-perfume-votes></div><div class="grid-x" style="width 100%; padding-top: 0.4rem; padding-bottom: 0.4rem;"><div id="cc399892" class="cell small-2" ><div ><div class="comments-avatar" style="position: relative;" itemprop="author" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person" itemscope><meta itemprop="name" content="respect1983"/><span class="idLinkify" title="https://www.fragrantica.com/member/616659"><img loading="lazy" itemprop="image" src="https://fimgs.net/himg/o.69247.png" class="comments-avatar"alt="respect1983" style="opacity: 0.85;"></span><div class="perfume-wearing-avatar"></div><div class="karma-avatar-new"><div id="karma399892ckNxM" class="ckNxM ck3x3"></div></div></div></div></div><div id="dd399892" class="cell small-10 flex-container flex-dir-column"><div class="flex-child-shrink" style="background: rgba(250,249,251,0.9); classy and smart.good sillage with average lasting.<br />

        <div class="strike-title"><span>Perfume Reviews</span></div>
    <div class="latest-list flex-container">

    // Check that service workers are supported
    if ('serviceWorker' in navigator) {
        // Use the window load event to keep the page load performant
        window.addEventListener('load', () => {
            navigator.serviceWorker.register('/service-worker.js?v=rtgH0e5cbbe5e5f689826b719ace22a5b2a11');
        });
    }
</script>
